page.title: 01REVIEW OF AIRDRIE
page.content: AIRDRIE (MEANING ON A HILL),BURGH, STRATHCLYDE REGION, SCOTLAND, 19 KM. EAST OF GLASGOW, INDS. ELECTRONICS PHARMACEUTICALS (WHISKEY AND IRON IN DECLINE) NEW RING ROAD, NEW HOSPICE, LEISURE CENTRE; HISTORICAL BUILDINGS: SIR JOHN WILSON TOWN HALL 1912, OLD TOWN HOUSE NOW MUNICIPAL CHAMBERS, ONE OF OLDEST BUILDINGS_HAS A TOWN CLOCK AND STEEPLE 1825; AIRDRIE SAVINGS BANK 1925, AIRDRIE PUBLIC LIBRARY NOW AIRDRIE ARTS CENTRE BUILT 1880 VISITED BY MR ANDREW CARNEGIE IN 1906; AIRDRIE PUBLIC BATHS 1935: ORIGINAL INDS. WEAVING BUT NOW IN DEMISE.WEAVERS COTTAGES ARE OLDEST BUILDINGS; HAS BEEN A MARKET TOWN SINCE 17TH CENTURY; MOTTO IS VIGILANTIBUS- TO THE WATCHFUL. AIRDRIE BELONGS TO AREA KNOWN AS THE MONKLANDS.
